text: What's up everyone? Run it through a quick market outlook for this coming week. We have a few things coming up and then I want to talk about DJ T, the stock. I want to talk about CRWD crowd strike and what's going on there as I'm still learning a little bit more about the technicalities behind it. So I thought we could do that together. And then I want to talk a little bit about how things like GameStop are looking for the week out ahead. So we have a few things that we're going to touch. First off, we can start with kind of a broad market overview of what events we have coming up this week, which you can see up here. We'll filter this out to be this coming week. And there are a few things that I think are worth directing your attention towards. The very first one is starting on the 23rd and it looks like really Monday is kind of super quiet. There are a couple earnings coming out. I think there's a Verizon stuff like that. So there's not a ton that I'm seeing there of significant interest. The 23rd is mostly home sales. So a couple of those will be larger impact, but not massively impactful either. The 24th is when we start getting some more inflation level data. This is really important. So things like the PMI from SP, we will absolutely want to keep an eye on those when

My guess is after this first one goes through, we probably would see a pretty, I think a pretty significant change in these probabilities would happen there. And there's a little bit more to it than that. It doesn't boil down at least as far as I can see to that. So what happened here? Pretty simple. We saw this trade come through and this was the filing date. That is important to differentiate from when the trade went on. There are leads and leads and lags to when trades are placed versus when they are filed. So in this case, the position was on since 30 June. And this is when they chose to file. And this fell in line with when they tend to file their stuff historically. The other thing that we noticed here is that there was a pretty interesting unilateral issue with their data. And you can see that they use a third party vendor and they applied essentially a 10,000 contract multiplier for everything, not just DGT, all their stuff.
